title: Kerri-Anne Kennerley turns heads in a see-through dress at Coles' Christmas with Curtis Stone event
text:
She's the Australian TV legend who co-hosts Studio 10.

And on Tuesday, Kerri-Anne Kennerley turned heads in a red sheer dress at the Coles' Christmas with Curtis Stone event.

The ageless beauty, 66, looked radiant as she beamed to the camera in her bold red see-through dress, featuring floral sleeves and edges.

Sheer daring! Kerri-Anne Kennerley (pictured) turned heads in a see-through dress at Coles' Christmas with Curtis Stone event on Tuesday

Kerri-Anne subtly showed off her ample assets through the mesh material of the dress.

The TV legend wore her signature blonde locks in a middle parting, perfectly framing her flawless skin and showing off her long dangly earrings.

The Studio 10 co-host finished off the look with a red leather handbag and a pair of peep-toe high heels.

Radiant in red! The ageless beauty looked radiant as she beamed to the camera in her bold red see-through dress, featuring floral sleeves and edges

Details: The Studio 10 co-host finished off the look with a red leather handbag and peep-toe high heels

Kerri Anne attended the Coles' Christmas dinner event, hosted by celebrity chef Curtis Stone.

Other celebrities attending the event included Anna Heinrich, Julie Bishop, Kylie Gillies and Lisa Clark.

It comes after Kerri-Anne revealed last week that she is still 'angry' over her husband John Kennerley's death.

Dressed to impress! Kerri-Anne subtly showed off her ample assets through the mesh material

John passed away in February, aged 75, almost three years after a freak accident at a Coffs Harbour golf course left him quadriplegic.

'I feel cheated, not just for myself and my loss but also for John and the life that he should have continued to live,' Kerri-Anne told The Australian Women's Weekly.

The Logie winner added that John's father lived to be 100 years old, so she always assumed her husband would have a long life.

'So anger, as a word, doesn't even begin to cover what I feel,' she said.
